roleset.name: not be dead, being alive, exist in some manner or for some length of time, alive
roleset.note: LIVE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'live' based on sentences in financial subcorpus and conversion from Chris' old file. This should be amusing. Verbnet entry 47.1, other framed members include depend. Framenet entry Residence and Thriving. (from live.01-v predicate notes)
LIVED-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on medi-tmprl1to8. (from lived.01-j)
LIVING-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on medi-tmprl1to8. (from living.01-j)

roles.note: Use argMs for modifiers: 'short-lived', etc. (from lived.01-j)

example.name: live-v: basic intransitive
example.text: John lives!

example.name: live-v: with location
example.text: John lives in a cardboard box under the Walnut Street bridge.
example.arg: in a cardboard box under the Walnut Street bridge

example.name: live-v: a kind of manner
example.text: He lived with her.

example.name: live-v: transitive
example.text: John lives a rich fulfilling life. No, really, he does!

example.name: living-n: Arg0, LOC
example.text: His works of the 1960s show the influence of his travels in Europe and his living in New York City at the height of the abstract expressionists.
example.arg: at the height of the abstract expressionists

example.name: living-n: Arg0,1
example.text: He forgot to mention his living a life of quiet.

example.name: lived-j: MNR and arg1
example.text: I would like to move into the next stage of my life as an older woman, hopefully putting the wisdom of a hard-lived life to good use, both at home and at work.

example.name: lived-j: arg1, TMP
example.text: The episode was very short - lived , and the patient was conversant throughout .

example.name: alive-j: Somewhat depressing example
example.text: In 10 yrs time with radiation alone, she has a 65% chance of PRO being alive and disease free.

roleset.name: endure
roleset.note: LIVE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'live' based on sentences in financial subcorpus and conversion from Chris' old file. This should be amusing. Verbnet entry 47.1, other framed members include depend. Framenet entry Residence and Thriving. (from live.02-v predicate notes)

example.name: live-v: live with
example.text: Richard Bernstein, senior quantitative analyst at Merrill Lynch& Co, says, ``My gut feel is that we'll live with those swings for a while.''

example.name: live-v: endure an infinitive S
example.text: Investors who sold everything after the crash of 1987 lived to regret it.
example.arg: Investors who sold everything after the crash of 1987

example.name: live-v: live through
example.text: John lived through the scary thunderstorm.

example.name: living-n: Arg0,1 (live through)
example.text: I suspect that it was his living through the economic depression of the 1930s--he walked some of the way with, and provided medical support to, the Jarrow hunger marches in 1936--and the war years that led to his strong views on social justice and left-wing political stance.
example.arg: through the economic depression of the 1930s

roleset.name: being broadcast in real time
roleset.note: LIVE-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on AMR data

role.descr: entity being broadcast in real time

example.name: live-j
example.text: Noguchi-1 tweeted *-1 live from the space station on his Twitter account .

roleset.name: withstand an incident until others forget,
roleset.note: LIVE_DOWN-V NOTES: Frames for 'live down' based on sentences in ectb2. (from live.06-v predicate notes)

example.name: live_down-v
example.text: * Life down that image.

example.name: living_down-n: Arg0,1
example.text: Furthest, and keenest of all, she read into the incident the impossibility of his living down his working-class origin.

example.name: live_on-v: token
example.text: John washed his socks, but their stench lives on.

example.name: living_on-n: Arg1,3
example.text: The worst part of dying is his living on without me.

example.name: live_up-v: typical usage
example.text: The current dispute involves allegations that Charlotte, N.C.-based First Union hasn't lived up to its responsibilities under the reinvestment act.
example.arg: to its responsibilities under the reinvestment act

example.name: living_up-n: Arg0,1
example.text: Often a court includes military leaders, law enforcement personnel, tax collectors and other bureaucrats that assist the nobleman in his living up to his responsibilities.

roleset.name: live to the end/completion
roleset.note: LIVE_OUT-V NOTES: Frame edited by Arrick (from live.05-v)

example.name: live_out-v: live_out
example.text: If it does that then in fact the ~UN can live out ... what it was supposed *-1 to be *T*-2.
example.arg: what it was supposed *-1 to be *T*-2.

example.name: living_out-n: Arg0,1
example.text: The worst would have been Milosevic walking free and the second worst would be his living out his days in a cushy prison facility similar to the one he's spent his last years in.
example.arg: in a cushy prison facility similar to the one he's spent his last years in

roleset.name: suitable to be lived in
roleset.note: LIVABLE-J NOTES: Added automatically by Julia. Related to live-v.01 (from livable.01-j)

role.descr: place that is suitable to be lived in

example.name: livable-j
example.text: We drove around, looked at a few houses, did a little sightseeing, and quietly came to the realization that it was a place that was livable.
